overview_summary: All five profiled neighbors have no documented public stance on the proposed development (all classified as "unknown" stance). None holds an official role or exceptional influence in the community; all appear to have a low community profile. This suggests a low concentration of high-influence neighbors in the immediate area.

neighbors.name: Joann E. Spann
neighbors.claims: Joann E. Spann owns a residential parcel in the Wood River Township area of Roxana (near East 8th Street) ([www.scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/document/691260247/Madison-County-Surplus-Property-1#:~:text=ITEM%20PARCEL%20NUMBER%20TOWNSHIP%20LOT,SIZE%20Madison%20County)). No evidence was found of her holding any public office or making statements on local development issues ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/Six-seek-three-Roxana-Village-Board-seats-12661806.php#:~:text=town%27s%20former%20mayor%2C%20are%20seeking,seats%20on%20the%20Village%20Board)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private homeowner; no public civic role

approach_recommendations.engage: A personal, neighborly approach is recommended – meet at her residence to listen to any concerns and emphasize how the project will respect neighborhood quiet and property values.

neighbors.name: John P. Segrest
neighbors.claims: John P. Segrest is the listed owner of a Roxana-area residential lot (Madison County PIN 19-2-08-34-12-203-012) in the same East 8th Street vicinity ([www.scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/document/691260247/Madison-County-Surplus-Property-1#:~:text=ITEM%20PARCEL%20NUMBER%20TOWNSHIP%20LOT,SIZE%20Madison%20County)). His name does not appear in local news archives or civic records, indicating no known public stance or roles in community affairs ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/Six-seek-three-Roxana-Village-Board-seats-12661806.php#:~:text=town%27s%20former%20mayor%2C%20are%20seeking,seats%20on%20the%20Village%20Board)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage him in an informal conversation at his home to understand any personal concerns. Emphasize transparency about the development and address common homeowner questions (e.g., property upkeep, traffic).

neighbors.name: William A. Forrester
neighbors.claims: William A. Forrester owns property in the immediate project area, recorded as a residential parcel in Roxana’s Wood River Township sector ([www.scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/document/691260247/Madison-County-Surplus-Property-1#:~:text=ITEM%20PARCEL%20NUMBER%20TOWNSHIP%20LOT,SIZE%20Madison%20County)). There are no public records of Forrester participating in local government or voicing opinions on development; his name is absent from local meeting minutes and news reports ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/Six-seek-three-Roxana-Village-Board-seats-12661806.php#:~:text=town%27s%20former%20mayor%2C%20are%20seeking,seats%20on%20the%20Village%20Board)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local resident; not known in civic sphere

approach_recommendations.engage: A courteous one-on-one approach focusing on information-sharing is advised. Highlight how the development plans will be mindful of the neighborhood’s character, and invite his feedback or questions.

neighbors.name: G. Craig Caldwell
neighbors.claims: G. Craig Caldwell (listed with first initial "G") is identified as owner of a residential parcel near E. 8th St. in Roxana ([www.scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/document/691260247/Madison-County-Surplus-Property-1#:~:text=ITEM%20PARCEL%20NUMBER%20TOWNSHIP%20LOT,SIZE%20Madison%20County)). The Caldwell family name has appeared in Roxana for decades ([www.e-yearbook.com](https://www.e-yearbook.com/yearbooks/Roxana_High_School_Rox_Yearbook/1969/Page_1.html#:~:text=National%20Honor%20Society%204,Honor%20Society%203%2C4%2C%20President%204)), but no evidence shows Craig Caldwell himself in any official role or making public comments on development ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/Six-seek-three-Roxana-Village-Board-seats-12661806.php#:~:text=town%27s%20former%20mayor%2C%20are%20seeking,seats%20on%20the%20Village%20Board)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime local family; no formal influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect through shared community context – e.g., mentioning local events or history – to build rapport. Approach with respect for his family’s long ties to the area, and provide clear details to address any questions about project impacts.

neighbors.name: Evelyn E. Harrison
neighbors.claims: Evelyn E. Harrison was a longtime area resident (b.1926) who passed away in 2020 at age 93 ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thetelegraph/name/evelyn-harrison-obituary?id=16436123#:~:text=ROXANA%20%E2%80%94%20Evelyn%20E,Anthony%27s%20Hospital%20in%20Alton)). She worked as a nurse’s aide at Wood River Township Hospital until retirement in 1986 ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thetelegraph/name/evelyn-harrison-obituary?id=16436123#:~:text=Evelyn%20worked%20as%20a%20nurse%27s,of%20the%20VFW%20Ladies%27%20Auxiliary)), and was active in local social organizations like the Wood River Eagles (and a VFW Auxiliary while living in Arizona) ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thetelegraph/name/evelyn-harrison-obituary?id=16436123#:~:text=Evelyn%20worked%20as%20a%20nurse%27s,of%20the%20VFW%20Ladies%27%20Auxiliary)). Her estate still holds her property, and one of her sons resides in Roxana ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thetelegraph/name/evelyn-harrison-obituary?id=16436123#:~:text=Survivors%20include%20three%20sons%2C%20Keith,and%20Danny%3B%20and%208%20great)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Elderly longtime resident; no formal civic role

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via her family (contact her son in Roxana as representative). Emphasize respect for the family’s long-standing presence and assure that the project will honor the community’s well-being.
